meanings.definition: An acute viral infection of the nervous system caused by a poliovirus.
meanings.sent1: Poliomyelitis can cause paralysis in some people.
meanings.sent2: Doctors work hard to prevent poliomyelitis through vaccination.
meanings.sent3: The poliomyelitis virus decided to take a vacation in the nervous system.
meanings.sent4: The impact of poliomyelitis on the nervous system is like a storm disrupting a peaceful town.
meanings.sent5: The image of poliomyelitis invading the nervous system is frightening.

meanings.definition: A disease that can lead to paralysis and muscle weakness.
meanings.sent1: After contracting poliomyelitis, the patient experienced muscle weakness.
meanings.sent2: The effects of poliomyelitis on the body can be devastating.
meanings.sent3: The poliomyelitis disease played a cruel trick on the muscles.
meanings.sent4: The grip of poliomyelitis on the body is like a vice squeezing tightly.
meanings.sent5: The memory of poliomyelitis causing paralysis is haunting.

meanings.definition: A condition characterized by inflammation of the gray matter of the spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: In severe cases, poliomyelitis can lead to inflammation in the spinal cord.
meanings.sent2: The inflammation caused by poliomyelitis can be painful.
meanings.sent3: The gray matter in the spinal cord threw a party, but poliomyelitis crashed it.
meanings.sent4: The inflammation from poliomyelitis is like a fire burning in the spinal cord.
meanings.sent5: The image of poliomyelitis inflaming the spinal cord is vivid.
